verb.description: Cause (someone) to feel embarrassed, ashamed, or humiliated.
examples: she was mortified to see her wrinkles in the mirror

verb.description: Subdue (the body or its needs and desires) by self-denial or discipline.
examples: return to heaven by mortifying the flesh

verb.description: (of flesh) be affected by gangrene or necrosis.
examples: the cut in Henry's arm had mortified

origin: Late Middle English (in the senses put to death, deaden, and subdue by self-denial): from Old French mortifier, from ecclesiastical Latin mortificare kill, subdue, from mors, mort- death.
